Articles.Content:
Hello,

i have having a problem with a rover that i have built.

I have three mods install and have no interesting in uninstalling any of them or the whole mission would be impossible.

So... the problem i am having is that i am trying to drive a rover on kerbal, i will be attaching a crane to the top of it using the Infernal Robotics mods and the KAS mod to build a mining base using the Kethane mod. The rover that i have build doesn't move. i have changed the design two or three times but still no movement, the wheels spin however the rover itself doesn't move.

I have attached a few pictures of the rover without the crane.

Does anyone notice anything wrong with it, no the brake aren't on for anyone who thinks that's the case.

Any help would be most grateful, thanks!

Edited February 28, 2014 by Vanamonde

Your wheels are rotated incorrectly. Due to the way KSP models surface contack if your wheels are not straight up and down they will not work. (This is a common problem with these wheels). The wide part should be on top.
Thanks for the reply, i turned the wheels around and it work thanks so much for the quick reply. Much love my friend
